Project Description
Records and shows XBox 360 Kinect skeleton data using windows forms. Saves the data as XML that can be read by other applications for use in animation.

The goal of this application is an XML file that lists the joint locations that can be used somewhere else.  A very simple demonstration of this used to animate a WebGL page using Three.js can be found here:

http://www.teddunsford.com/Animate/index.html

It takes a second to load because I am not doing anything sophisticated for this page, like hiding the xml through server requests that return, for instance, json objects.  Instead, I just use the Anim.js javascript to parse the XML file directly.  While slow and inelegant, it serves as a basic demonstration that everyone can see the source for for parsing the joint XML file using javascript.
